hurricane.title: Deep Learning for Hurricane Forecasting
hurricane.description:
In Fall of 2017, I was the Artificial Intelligence Project Lead for Upsilon Pi Epsilon's SparkDev program. The project consisted of predicting the trajectory paths of hurricanes using a recurrent neural network (RNN). I lead a group of six students to complete this project in nine weeks using Python and Keras API.

Upon completion of the project, I decided to pursue this as an independent research project. With the ever-evolving field of artificial intelligence and the sporadic behavior of hurricane trajectories, we utilized a fine grid along with a recurrent neural network to learn the nonlinear response of hurricane trajectories. As first author, I was able to present at a seminar for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administrationâ€™s (NOAA) National Hurricane Center (NHC). Following positive feedback from the NOAA scientists, we successfully published "Predicting Hurricane Trajectories using a Recurrent Neural Network" to the 2019 Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence (AAAI) conference under the applied artificial intelligence track to introduce deep learning as a way to enhance the environmental forecasting techniques employed by NHC for more accurate predictions.

mitlincolnlab.title: MIT Lincoln Laboratory
mitlincolnlab.description: Conducted exploratory data analysis to assist in the process of improving machine learning approaches that predict cyber-attacks. Contributed to the existing set of metrics by proposing new evaluation techniques that use statistical methods, natural language processing, and clustering techniques. (Advisors: Dr. Joseph Zipkin and Dr. Amy Hughes)

tableValues.What: Cyber Analytics + Decision Systems Research Internship
